newsitem.title: DUBAI: Lufthansa, SIA to change cargoes in Sharjah.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa, SIA to change cargoes in Sharjah.

text.p: Lufthansa Cargo AG and Singapore Airlines will interchange cargoes at Sharjah in a bid to cut operating costs under a new arrangement starting next week with the introduction of winter schedules, Kim Bullen, the German airline's regional Middle East cargo director said.

Two of the four weekly freighters will intercharge their cargoes at Lufthansa's Sharjah hub. These will make for more efficient aircraft usage and better crew rostering, he told a news conference on Monday.
"This is a cost-lowering partnership," Bullen added.

Separately, Lufthansa Cargo's business development vice-president Michael Kraus said the carrier would develop strategic cargo partnerships in Asia, including those with SIA and Thai International Airways Ltd.

Bullen said the airline's new Indian joint venture, Lufthansa Cargo India, would be operating five Boeing 727-200 feeder freighters from end-1996 from Sharjah in the United Arab Emirates to all major cities in India, Pakistan, Nepal and Sri Lanka.
